Let's build a small graph to illustrate the effect of $\tau$ on the graph.

```{r}
edge1 <- rbind(c(1,0),c(0,0))
edge2 <- rbind(c(0,1),c(0,0))
edge3 <- rbind(c(-1,1),c(0,1))
theta <- seq(from = pi,to = 2*pi,length.out = 50)
edge4 <- cbind(-1 + 0.5*sin(theta), 0.5 + 0.5*cos(theta))
edge5 <- rbind(c(0,1),c(1,1))
edge6 <- rbind(c(0,0),c(-1,0))
edges <- list(edge1, edge2, edge3, edge4, edge5, edge6)
```

```{r}
graph <- metric_graph$new(edges = edges)
graph$build_mesh(h = 0.01, continuous = TRUE)
edge_number <- graph$mesh$VtE
XY_graph <- graph$mesh$V
```

```{r, fig.cap = captioner("Edge directions.")}
graph$plot(direction = TRUE) + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(text = element_text(family = "Palatino"))
```


```{r}
A <- -0.4
B <- 1
f <- edge_number[,1]/4# discontinuous covariate
g <- A*(XY_graph[, 1]^2 - XY_graph[, 2]^2) + B # continuous covariate
h <- function(x) {
  return((A - B)*x^2 - 2*(A - B)*x)
}
H <- function(x) {
  return(16*(A-B)*x^3+36*(-A+B)*x^2+24*(A-B)*x+5*(-A+B))
}
N <- function(x) ifelse(x <= 0.5, 0, H(x))
```


```{r, fig.cap = captioner("This is how the values are changed.")}
# plot Hp
x <- seq(0.4, 1, length.out = 100)
plot(x, N(x), type = "l", col = "blue", lwd = 2, xlab = "x", ylab = "y")
lines(x, H(x), col = "red", lwd = 2)
points(0.5, H(0.5), col = "red", pch = 19)
```


```{r, out.width = "100%", fig.cap = captioner("Edge number.")}
df <- data.frame(XY_graph, edge_number,f,g) %>%
  mutate(g_new = if_else(V1 == 2, N(1*(1-d.e)), g))

p <- ggplot(df, aes(x = X1, y = X2, color = factor(V1))) +
  geom_point(size = 1) +   # Adjust the point size if needed
  scale_color_manual(values = c("red", "blue", "green", "purple", "orange", "skyblue")) +  # Custom colors
  labs(x = "x", y = "y", color = "edge number") +
  theme_minimal()
ggplotly(p)
```

```{r}
# Define the matrices B.tau and B.kappa
B.tau <- cbind(0, 1, 0, df$g_new, 0)
B.kappa <- cbind(0, 0, 1, 0, df$g_new)
# Log-regression coefficients
theta <- c(0, 0, 1, 1) 
# Choose alpha
nu <- 3/2
alpha <- nu + 1/2
# Compute the operator
op <- rSPDE::spde.matern.operators(graph = graph,
                                      B.tau = B.tau,
                                      B.kappa =  B.kappa,
                                      parameterization = "spde",
                                      theta = theta,
                                      alpha = alpha)
# Simulate the non-stationary field
u <- simulate(op)

model_for_tau <- exp(B.tau[,-1]%*%theta)
model_for_kappa <- exp(B.kappa[,-1]%*%theta)
```

```{r}
Q <- precision(op)
est_sigma <- sqrt(diag(INLA::inla.qinv(Q))) 
```

```{r, out.width = "100%", fig.cap = captioner("Marginal stardard deviation of the non-stationary model.")}

  config(mathjax = 'cdn') %>% 
  layout(title = TeX("\\sigma"))
```
